adjectives.description: incredulous (comparative more incredulous, superlative most incredulous)

entries.meaning: Skeptical, disbelieving, or unable to believe. [from 16th c.]
Expressing or indicative of incredulity. [from 17th c.]
examples: Reactions at Sun's campus, an hour's drive from San Francisco, ranged from the fearful to the incredulous.

entries.meaning: (largely obsolete, now only nonstandard) Difficult to believe; incredible. [from 17th c.]
examples: Faced with these facts, we find it incredulous that [the] defendant had any intent other than the armed robbery of the service station.
